summary: Aren’t You a Little Young?
title: Aren’t You a Little Young?
body:
This is my Secret Santa gift fro @acastleintheair ! (I’m sorry it’s late, tumblr was a butt) However, I got the prompt from @hollandroos ‘s 15k writing challenge :) If this gets positive feedback, I might make an epilogue of sorts.

prompt: “You’re my best friend’s sister, but I don’t want that to stop us.”

words: 7k

warnings: fluff and angst(?) , minimal language

“Wow dude, senior year, that’s crazy.” Ned Leeds nudged his best friend in the side.

“I know, it seems like just yesterday we were going to homecoming for the first time.” Peter Parker adjusted his backpack straps as the two walked to school.

Yes yes, these two trouble makers were now seniors in high school. Time flies when you’re fighting crime.

“Man, I can’t wait to go to college, our family dropped Mia off at her college last month and the campus was so cool!” Ned gushed about his older sister, oblivious to his best friend’s face heating up.

Unknown fact about Peter Parker, he had always been crushing on his best friend’s older sister. Sure she was only a year older, but she had always been so beautiful. She was always there whenever Peter was over at the Leed’s household and, in a way, she was the reason Peter was so hung up on physics. Mia had always been somewhat of a “nerd” and Peter just wanted to get her attention.

“Weird how we’re all going to be at MIT huh?” Peter scratched the back of his head and they neared the school.

“Kinda,” Ned shrugged “I mean, it’s not like it’s going to be like old times, Mia will probably have her own group of friends, maybe even a boyfriend by the time we graduate.” Peter’s hand dropped from his neck

The first semester of the boys’ year flew by. They would’ve never guessed how fast their last year of high school would go by. But finally, it was Christmas break, and everyone was heading out or home for the holidays.

As normal, Aunt May and Peter were invited to the Leed’s place for Christmas, and as normal, Aunt May was bringing her famous frozen lasagna.

Peter sat in his room, fresh out of school, staring at his messy desk. He knew if Aunt May stepped foot in his room he would never hear the end of how he needs to learn to keep his own place clean.

*bing!*

The boy glanced over at his phone and saw a text from Ned.

Guy in Chair: hey dude, Mia came home a day early so our family is gonna go hang out. maybe we can hang tomorrow?

Spidey-boy: hey no hard feelings! that’s totally fine, tell mia i said hi!

He hit send and fell back on his bed and sighed. He glanced to his closet, realizing the free time he now had.

Nothing like a little spidey-time to get rid of some boredom

Peter rolled off his bed and suited up.

“Peter?!” Peter flinched at the high pitched scream and quickly reached out to cover the college girl’s mouth.

“Shhhh! Do you want me to get caught?!” Peter threw off his mask and it landed on the ground somewhere.

Peter had decided to go on patrol when Ned went out with his family. He was out for hours, loosing track of time as the sun went down. It was well after dark when he had spotted some perv attacking a young woman in an alley. As he interfered to save the woman, he learned that it was none other than his best friend’s sister, Mia Leeds.

“Peter what the hell is this?” The girl whisper yelled. She had never been more confused in her life. Her younger brother’s best friend had just saved her from being sexually assaulted… but in some kind of spider suit?

“It’s- it’s kinda hard to explain in an abandoned parking garage, Mia! If you would just calm down, I could explain.” Peter explained as he fidgeted with his hands.

“You expect me to calm down?! One second I’m being attacked by some perv, then the next someone in some kind of,” She gestured to the boy’s suit “bug get up swoops me up and all within the same ten seconds, I’m flying through the air! And now we’re in an abandoned parking garage and I found out that the super hunk that saved me is my little brother’s best friend?” Mia’s hands were flying around as she spoke, she tended to talk with her hands. Peter was desperately trying to calm her down so he could talk, and also so no one would hear her yelling.

“Mia, Mia I know it’s weird but-” He stopped and looked at the older girl in front of him. “Did you say I’m a… hunk?” Mia’s face started to redden with blush while Peter’s mouth tugged into a smirk.

“Shut up, Parker!” She yelled at him, crossing her arms and ducking her head. “It’s not like I’m attracted to you or anything, you just have really nice muscles is all.” Peter’s smile was still plastered on his face.

“What- what would happen, do you think, if you DID have a crush on me?” Peter stayed where he was, not wanting to overwhelm his childhood friend. His smile soon became a smirk of teasing. Mia’s head shot up to look at the younger boy.

“Excuse me? Why would you even ask that?” Mia scoffed, arms still crossed. Peter’s eyes rolled to the sky and then met back up with hers.

“Because maybe I do have a crush on you. Maybe I have for a while.” Peter mirrored her in the sense of crossing his arms over his chest. “I’m not a little kid anymore, Mia. Yeah, I’m still in High School but I’m eighteen now. A lot more grown up than you remember.” Mia’s face continued to redden and she avoided looking at the spidey-boy.

“Okay but I’m still in college. It’s not like that will ever work.” She huffed, starting to call off all the reasons she never even entertained the thought of what it would be like with this high school boy.

“And? I’m going to that same college next year. You and I are both good people, we can make it through a semester of a long distance relationship.” Peter took a step closer, trying to emphasize his point.

“Well we’re not going to be majoring in the same thing!” Another dumb point. The boy scoffed again, uncrossing his arms.

“Really? You’re smarter than that. People don’t have to be the same major to be together.” Mia knew that. She never admitted to it being a good reason. It was just a reason. Peter had continued to knock her off her pegs, but she had one last fight to put up.

“What about Ned?” She finally brought her eyes up to his, confident that this would stunt his confidence. She was sure that this argument would be the be all end all of this conversation.

Mia had known Peter for as long as she can remember. There was a reason she never really thought about getting together with Peter, or even allowing herself to have a crush on him. Ned had a friend named Ryan, they were really close. Not as close as him and Peter, but still pretty close. Mia had allowed herself to fall for Ryan and they ended up dating. Due to Ryan being more immature than Mia, they broke up for stupid reasons. But that led to Ryan and Ned not hanging out or talking as much. Ryan would always talk trash about Mia and Ned wouldn’t allow it. Ned purposely stopped hanging around Ryan, and Mia could see that it made Ned disappointed. So when Peter started high school with Ned and Mia noticed his face lightly dusted with freckles or his eyes that were pools of chocolate and honey, or even his beautiful brown curls that would fall over his forehead, she forbid herself from letting her heart take over.

So she was sure that this argument would be the one to make him lose that bright fire in his eyes. But it was Mia who was caught by surprise by this statement. Peter shook his head and let out a low chuckle.

“Ned? What about Ned? You think he’d going to care if we’re dating.?” Peter put his hands on the college girl’s shoulders. “Mia,” His voice was low and quiet, sending chills up Mia’s spine. “If Ned has a problem with us going out, then he’s not my best friend after all. He knows how long I’ve had a crush on you and he knows I would never, ever, hurt you. I don’t care what people would think. I don’t care if this gets me some kind of bragging rights for dating a college girl. I don’t care about any of that stuff. All I care about is you.” Peter removed his hands from her shoulders and they fell to his own sides. “Ned’s told me about the idiotic college boys that you’ve been dealing with this semester and it makes me so mad. You don’t deserve to be treated like that. You deserve me.”

Mia was shocked by his sudden boldness. Peter used to never talk more than three or four words when more than Ned was present. But here he was, fighting for her, making a case for them to be together. He really had grown up.

“You’re my best friend’s sister, but I don’t want that to stop us. You know me. You know how well I’d treat you. All day,” He stepped closer, leaning next to her ear and lowering his voice “and all night.” When he leaned back out Mia couldn’t resist. Her heart said screw you to her brain and there was no going back now.

She put her hands on his cheeks and pulled him back towards her. Their lips collided and Peter tensed up at first impact. When his brain finally processed what was happening, his hands fell to her waist and grabbed them. It was a short and simple kiss, very sweet and romantic. Mia was the one to pull back, revealing the biggest smile on Peter’s face. He was so happy he couldn’t even form words. He didn’t need to, Mia knew exactly what to say.

“Let’s give it a shot.”

@ninjamidnight

“I know, it seems like just yesterday we were going to homecoming for the first time.” Peter Parker adjusted his backpack straps as the two walked to school.

Yes yes, these two trouble makers were now seniors in high school. Time flies when you’re fighting crime.

“Man, I can’t wait to go to college, our family dropped Mia off at her college last month and the campus was so cool!” Ned gushed about his older sister, oblivious to his best friend’s face heating up.

Unknown fact about Peter Parker, he had always been crushing on his best friend’s older sister. Sure she was only a year older, but she had always been so beautiful. She was always there whenever Peter was over at the Leed’s household and, in a way, she was the reason Peter was so hung up on physics. Mia had always been somewhat of a “nerd” and Peter just wanted to get her attention.

“Weird how we’re all going to be at MIT huh?” Peter scratched the back of his head and they neared the school.

“Kinda,” Ned shrugged “I mean, it’s not like it’s going to be like old times, Mia will probably have her own group of friends, maybe even a boyfriend by the time we graduate.” Peter’s hand dropped from his neck

The first semester of the boys’ year flew by. They would’ve never guessed how fast their last year of high school would go by. But finally, it was Christmas break, and everyone was heading out or home for the holidays.

As normal, Aunt May and Peter were invited to the Leed’s place for Christmas, and as normal, Aunt May was bringing her famous frozen lasagna.

Peter sat in his room, fresh out of school, staring at his messy desk. He knew if Aunt May stepped foot in his room he would never hear the end of how he needs to learn to keep his own place clean.

*bing!*

The boy glanced over at his phone and saw a text from Ned.

Guy in Chair: hey dude, Mia came home a day early so our family is gonna go hang out. maybe we can hang tomorrow?

Spidey-boy: hey no hard feelings! that’s totally fine, tell mia i said hi!

He hit send and fell back on his bed and sighed. He glanced to his closet, realizing the free time he now had.

Nothing like a little spidey-time to get rid of some boredom

Peter rolled off his bed and suited up.

“Peter?!” Peter flinched at the high pitched scream and quickly reached out to cover the college girl’s mouth.

“Shhhh! Do you want me to get caught?!” Peter threw off his mask and it landed on the ground somewhere.

Peter had decided to go on patrol when Ned went out with his family. He was out for hours, loosing track of time as the sun went down. It was well after dark when he had spotted some perv attacking a young woman in an alley. As he interfered to save the woman, he learned that it was none other than his best friend’s sister, Mia Leeds.

“Peter what the hell is this?” The girl whisper yelled. She had never been more confused in her life. Her younger brother’s best friend had just saved her from being sexually assaulted… but in some kind of spider suit?

“It’s- it’s kinda hard to explain in an abandoned parking garage, Mia! If you would just calm down, I could explain.” Peter explained as he fidgeted with his hands.

“You expect me to calm down?! One second I’m being attacked by some perv, then the next someone in some kind of,” She gestured to the boy’s suit “bug get up swoops me up and all within the same ten seconds, I’m flying through the air! And now we’re in an abandoned parking garage and I found out that the super hunk that saved me is my little brother’s best friend?” Mia’s hands were flying around as she spoke, she tended to talk with her hands. Peter was desperately trying to calm her down so he could talk, and also so no one would hear her yelling.

“Mia, Mia I know it’s weird but-” He stopped and looked at the older girl in front of him. “Did you say I’m a… hunk?” Mia’s face started to redden with blush while Peter’s mouth tugged into a smirk.

“Shut up, Parker!” She yelled at him, crossing her arms and ducking her head. “It’s not like I’m attracted to you or anything, you just have really nice muscles is all.” Peter’s smile was still plastered on his face.

“What- what would happen, do you think, if you DID have a crush on me?” Peter stayed where he was, not wanting to overwhelm his childhood friend. His smile soon became a smirk of teasing. Mia’s head shot up to look at the younger boy.

“Excuse me? Why would you even ask that?” Mia scoffed, arms still crossed. Peter’s eyes rolled to the sky and then met back up with hers.

“Because maybe I do have a crush on you. Maybe I have for a while.” Peter mirrored her in the sense of crossing his arms over his chest. “I’m not a little kid anymore, Mia. Yeah, I’m still in High School but I’m eighteen now. A lot more grown up than you remember.” Mia’s face continued to redden and she avoided looking at the spidey-boy.

“Okay but I’m still in college. It’s not like that will ever work.” She huffed, starting to call off all the reasons she never even entertained the thought of what it would be like with this high school boy.

“And? I’m going to that same college next year. You and I are both good people, we can make it through a semester of a long distance relationship.” Peter took a step closer, trying to emphasize his point.

“Well we’re not going to be majoring in the same thing!” Another dumb point. The boy scoffed again, uncrossing his arms.

“Really? You’re smarter than that. People don’t have to be the same major to be together.” Mia knew that. She never admitted to it being a good reason. It was just a reason. Peter had continued to knock her off her pegs, but she had one last fight to put up.

“What about Ned?” She finally brought her eyes up to his, confident that this would stunt his confidence. She was sure that this argument would be the be all end all of this conversation.

Mia had known Peter for as long as she can remember. There was a reason she never really thought about getting together with Peter, or even allowing herself to have a crush on him. Ned had a friend named Ryan, they were really close. Not as close as him and Peter, but still pretty close. Mia had allowed herself to fall for Ryan and they ended up dating. Due to Ryan being more immature than Mia, they broke up for stupid reasons. But that led to Ryan and Ned not hanging out or talking as much. Ryan would always talk trash about Mia and Ned wouldn’t allow it. Ned purposely stopped hanging around Ryan, and Mia could see that it made Ned disappointed. So when Peter started high school with Ned and Mia noticed his face lightly dusted with freckles or his eyes that were pools of chocolate and honey, or even his beautiful brown curls that would fall over his forehead, she forbid herself from letting her heart take over.

So she was sure that this argument would be the one to make him lose that bright fire in his eyes. But it was Mia who was caught by surprise by this statement. Peter shook his head and let out a low chuckle.

“Ned? What about Ned? You think he’d going to care if we’re dating.?” Peter put his hands on the college girl’s shoulders. “Mia,” His voice was low and quiet, sending chills up Mia’s spine. “If Ned has a problem with us going out, then he’s not my best friend after all. He knows how long I’ve had a crush on you and he knows I would never, ever, hurt you. I don’t care what people would think. I don’t care if this gets me some kind of bragging rights for dating a college girl. I don’t care about any of that stuff. All I care about is you.” Peter removed his hands from her shoulders and they fell to his own sides. “Ned’s told me about the idiotic college boys that you’ve been dealing with this semester and it makes me so mad. You don’t deserve to be treated like that. You deserve me.”

Mia was shocked by his sudden boldness. Peter used to never talk more than three or four words when more than Ned was present. But here he was, fighting for her, making a case for them to be together. He really had grown up.

“You’re my best friend’s sister, but I don’t want that to stop us. You know me. You know how well I’d treat you. All day,” He stepped closer, leaning next to her ear and lowering his voice “and all night.” When he leaned back out Mia couldn’t resist. Her heart said screw you to her brain and there was no going back now.

She put her hands on his cheeks and pulled him back towards her. Their lips collided and Peter tensed up at first impact. When his brain finally processed what was happening, his hands fell to her waist and grabbed them. It was a short and simple kiss, very sweet and romantic. Mia was the one to pull back, revealing the biggest smile on Peter’s face. He was so happy he couldn’t even form words. He didn’t need to, Mia knew exactly what to say.

“Let’s give it a shot.”

summary: Nature
body:
Nature

Peter Parker: I mean, what I do sometimes requires violence, but I’m not a violent man, I’m really not. But I just–

Mary Jane: You wanted to deck her.

Peter: Twice. And I hate feeling that way. Why is it that people feel the need to take whatever little authority they have and shove it down your throat? And the smaller the authority, the bigger the shove.

Aunt May: It offends you, doesn’t it?

Peter: Yeah, it does.

Aunt May: Why?

Peter: I – What do you mean, why?

Aunt May: Why does it offend you?

Peter: Shouldn’t it?

Aunt May: If a lion broke out of its cage at the zoo, and bit you, it would hurt, sure, and you’d be upset, of course. But would you be offended?

Peter: No, of course not.

Aunt May: Why?

Peter: Because that’s the nature of a lion.

Aunt May: Some people by nature are kind and charitable. You could say that some people, including at least one person at this table, are by their nature heroes. Ben always reminded me that we each contain all the nobler and meaner aspects of humanity, but some get a bigger dose than others of one thing or another.

Some are petty, and mean, and uncharitable. That’s their nature. You can hope for better, even try to lead them to be and you may even succeed. But when they behave badly, it’s right to be upset by it, or hurt by it, but you can be no more offended by it than you can when a lion bites you

summary: Do I dislike Spider-Man #1 because it’s actually bad or because I know the guy who wrote it was an amateur at the time? And, if...
body:
Do I dislike Spider-Man #1 because it’s actually bad or because I know the guy who wrote it was an amateur at the time? And, if it’s actually bad, is it the kinda bad that can be justified because it’s the first issue and requires an introduction to many things? Does it actually need an introduction, since it’s about one of, if not the, most popular super-hero at the time, for whom this would be his fourth title, not counting Marvel Tales, which are reprints, and with one of those titles going bi-weekly?

Also, the conundrum: with more titles in the 90′s, the more I can delay going into the “Spider-Man is about youth”, OMD, Slott-era. On the other hand, I’m stuck on the 90′s so is it even worth it.

summary: Spider-Man Exerpt
body:
Spider-Man Exerpt

Merry Christmas/Happy Holidays! As promised, here’s an expert of of the Spider-Man fanfiction I’m ever so slowly working on. I’m not sure when this will be up, but I’ll let y'all know when it hits AO3–check Wolvesandwerewolves. :) No reblogs, please, although I appreciate likes/comments!

Here’s Peter Parker meeting Dr. Bruce Banner. This scene in particular was inspired by a few different Tumblr posts circling around. :)

—————————————————————————

The lab isn’t huge, but it’s big–bigger than the one at school, for sure. There’s metal tables and Iron Man suits around the room, microscopes and science posters. A man stands at one table, dark head bowed over a microscope. He’s wearing a dark purple shirt and jeans.

“Brucie Bear,” Mr. Stark says flipplantly, leading Peter into the room, “you missed lunch yesterday.”

“Sorry, Tony,” the man says, not turning around. “I thought I was getting somewhere with this. Hey, there’s a vial of blood in that fridge over there, would you mind–" 

"Actually, yes I would. There’s someone here I want you to meet.”

“Hmm?” he murmurs, turning around. 

Peter’s eyes widen when he sees him, and his mouth opens a bit. Dr. Banner frowns at him, glancing at Mr. Stark with a confused, shy expression on his face. 

“Bruce,” Mr. Starks says, “meet Peter Parker. Mr. Parker, this is–" 

"Doctor Banner,” Peter says awed. He clears his throat, glancing at Mr. Stark with a wide eyed expression. “I–uh–" 

"I–” Bruce sighs, looking uncomfortable. He looks to Tony, a miserable, accusing look in his eye before turning back to Peter. “I’m the Hulk, I know. Listen, I’m not sure what you’ve read, but–" 

"That’s–I don’t care about the Hulk–uh, sorry–not that he isn’t a great fighter! And he’s–you’ve–done a lot for this country and the city and of course you saved Mr. Stark when New York was invaded, so I guess I don’t really not care about the Hulk, I mean–oh, jeez–”

“Peter,” Mr. Stark says, laughing and patting his back. “Breathe.”

“Breathe. Right, no, I’m just–” he takes a deep breath, shakes his head, God he’s so flustered, he’s making such a bad impression in front of two renowned scientists, Ned is going to freak. “You’re Bruce Banner. Your work on–on anti electric collisions is–is–" 

"Unparalleled?” Mr. Stark says, helpfully, smirking. 

“Yes!” Peter nods frantically. “I read your paper, Dr. Banner, about theories of the atmospheric conditions of the galaxy and the potential manipulation of–" 

"I’m sorry,” Dr. Banner says, holding his hands up. “How old are you?”

“Uh, fifteen. Almost sixteen.” He feels his cheeks reddening. “Um, there’s a picture of you on the wall in my science classroom,” he says, trying to explain his freak out. “And last semester I wrote a four page paper on your expiriments with Gama radiation and the conditions of–well, what went… wrong, exactly, and why your body reacted the way it did and how and also what that could mean for, y'know, the future of science dealing with specific gamma radiation ideals, and–well–I mean, you can read it, if you want. But only if you want to! I tried to be respectful of everything, y'know, and Ned helped me edit and source. Uh, you really don’t have to read it, if you don’t want. I mean–yeah. It’s okay.”

“He’s adorable, isn’t he?” Mr. Stark says, sounding smug. “He’s like a mini-me, but with more innocence." 

"What?” Peter says, startled. 

“You–you don’t care about the Hulk? Just science?” Dr. Banner asks, looking dazed and confused.

“Um.” Peter shrugs, trying to be honest while not being mean. “Sorry?" 

"Don’t–don’t apologize. What did you say your name was again?" 

"Peter. Peter Parker. It’s–it’s really nice to meet you, Dr. Banner." 

Dr. Banner steps forward, holding his hand out for Peter. Oh, my God, he’s shaking Bruce Banner’s hand. "Likewise,” he says, a thoughtful expression on his face. “Parker. So, you aren’t Tony’s–?" 

"Assistant? Intern? Yes, you’re hired.”

“I’m hired? This is so cool! Thank you so much, Mr. Stark!" 

Mr. Stark smiles, turns towards Dr. Banner. "I’m telling you, Bruce. He’s a genius in his own right. It has nothing to do with me.”

Peter wants to protest–Mr. Stark is a huge influence for him. But he’s already embarrassed himself enough today. "Thanks, Mr. Stark.“

"Yeah, don’t mention it, kid. Hey, you wanna know where I found this little nerd?" 

Dr. Banner hesitates. "I’m guessing downstairs, what with the… apocalypse outside. In which case, I’m sorry, Peter.”

“Thanks,” Peter says, quietly. “Actually, I, uh, came looking for you guys. The Avengers. We weren’t sure you survived. MJ and I, we wanted to leave the city after we searched for more of our friends, but Ned refused to go anywhere until we found you guys.”

“We’re doing all we can,” Dr. Banner says gently, grimacing. “The others are out everyday looking for survivors, and I’m searching for a cause or a cure, but. I’m sorry if what we’re doing isn’t enough.”

“New York is a big city,” Peter says. He nods determinedly. “I want to help.”
